metadata.title: CVE-2022-42896 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
There are use-after-free vulnerabilities in the Linux kernel'snet/bluetooth/l2cap_core.c's l2cap_connect and l2cap_le_connect_reqfunctions which may allow code execution and leaking kernel memory(respectively) remotely via Bluetooth. A remote attacker could execute codeleaking kernel memory via Bluetooth if within proximity of the victim. Werecommend upgrading past commit https://www.google.com/urlhttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/711f8c3fb3db61897080468586b970c87c61d9e4https://www.google.com/url

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42896` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-236-generic - 4.4.0-236.270
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-236-generic - 4.4.0-236.270
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-236-lowlatency - 4.4.0-236.270
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-202-generic - 4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-202-generic - 4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-202-lowlatency - 4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1116-kvm - 4.4.0-1116.126
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1153-aws - 4.4.0-1153.168
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1148-aws - 4.15.0-1148.160~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-azure - 4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1143-gcp - 4.15.0-1143.159~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1113-oracle - 4.15.0-1113.124~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-236.270').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-202.213~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1116.126').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1153.168').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1148.160~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1159.174~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1143.159~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1113.124~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
